commit_message:
Support upload domain config files to database

To ease the transition from the files based specification of
domain specific configurations to the database version, we
support a domain_config_upload option in keystone-manage.

Partially Implements: blueprint domain-config-ext
Change-Id: I0ce8d063d9e9f6fe95965d0ed18e825e2ad80ee4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/64/160364/19 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import uuid from oslo_config import cfg from keystone import exception from keystone import resourceCONF = cfg.CONF CONF.unregister_opt(cli.command_opt) class CliDomainConfigAllTestCase(tests.SQLDriverOverrides, tests.TestCase): def setUp(self): self.useFixture(database.Database()) super(CliDomainConfigAllTestCase, self).setUp() self.load_backends() self.config_fixture.config( group='identity', domain_specific_drivers_enabled=True, domain_config_dir=tests.TESTCONF + '/domain_configs_multi_ldap') self.domain_count = 3 self.setup_initial_domains() def config_files(self): CONF.register_cli_opt(cli.command_opt) self.addCleanup(self.cleanup) config_files = super(CliDomainConfigAllTestCase, self).config_files() config_files.append(tests.dirs.tests_conf('backend_sql.conf')) return config_files def cleanup(self): CONF.reset() CONF.unregister_opt(cli.command_opt) def config(self, config_files): CONF(args=['domain_config_upload', '--all'], project='keystone', default_config_files=config_files) def setup_initial_domains(self): def create_domain(domain): try: ref = self.resource_api.create_domain( domain['id'], domain) except exception.Conflict: ref = ( self.resource_api.get_domain_by_name(domain['name'])) return ref self.domains = {} for x in range(1, self.domain_count): domain = 'domain%s' % x self.domains[domain] = create_domain( {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': domain}) self.domains['domain_default'] = create_domain( resource.calc_default_domain()) def test_config_upload(self): # The values below are the same as in the domain_configs_multi_ldap # directory of test config_files. default_config = { 'ldap': {'url': 'fake://memory', 'user': 'cn=Admin', 'password': 'password', 'suffix': 'cn=example,cn=com'}, 'identity': {'driver': 'keystone.identity.backends.ldap.Identity'} } domain1_config = { 'ldap': {'url': 'fake://memory1', 'user': 'cn=Admin', 'password': 'password', 'suffix': 'cn=example,cn=com'}, 'identity': {'driver': 'keystone.identity.backends.ldap.Identity'} } domain2_config = { 'ldap': {'url': 'fake://memory', 'user': 'cn=Admin', 'password': 'password', 'suffix': 'cn=myroot,cn=com', 'group_tree_dn': 'ou=UserGroups,dc=myroot,dc=org', 'user_tree_dn': 'ou=Users,dc=myroot,dc=org'}, 'identity': {'driver': 'keystone.identity.backends.ldap.Identity'} } cli.DomainConfigUpload.main() res = self.domain_config_api.get_config_with_sensitive_info( CONF.identity.default_domain_id) self.assertEqual(default_config, res) res = self.domain_config_api.get_config_with_sensitive_info( self.domains['domain1']['id']) self.assertEqual(domain1_config, res) res = self.domain_config_api.get_config_with_sensitive_info( self.domains['domain2']['id']) self.assertEqual(domain2_config, res) class CliDomainConfigSingleDomainTestCase(CliDomainConfigAllTestCase): def config(self, config_files): CONF(args=['domain_config_upload', '--domain-name', 'Default'], project='keystone', default_config_files=config_files) def test_config_upload(self): # The values below are the same as in the domain_configs_multi_ldap # directory of test config_files. default_config = { 'ldap': {'url': 'fake://memory', 'user': 'cn=Admin', 'password': 'password', 'suffix': 'cn=example,cn=com'}, 'identity': {'driver': 'keystone.identity.backends.ldap.Identity'} } cli.DomainConfigUpload.main() res = self.domain_config_api.get_config_with_sensitive_info( CONF.identity.default_domain_id) self.assertEqual(default_config, res) res = self.domain_config_api.get_config_with_sensitive_info( self.domains['domain1']['id']) self.assertEqual({}, res) res = self.domain_config_api.get_config_with_sensitive_info( self.domains['domain2']['id']) self.assertEqual({}, res) class CliDomainConfigNoOptionsTestCase(CliDomainConfigAllTestCase): def config(self, config_files): CONF(args=['domain_config_upload'], project='keystone', default_config_files=config_files) def test_config_upload(self): self.assertRaises( ValueError, super(CliDomainConfigNoOptionsTestCase, self).test_config_upload) class CliDomainConfigTooManyOptionsTestCase(CliDomainConfigAllTestCase): def config(self, config_files): CONF(args=['domain_config_upload', '--all', '--domain-name', 'Default'], project='keystone', default_config_files=config_files) def test_config_upload(self): self.assertRaises( ValueError, super(CliDomainConfigTooManyOptionsTestCase, self). test_config_upload)

added_lines: # Get v3 token data and exclude building v3 specific catalog. This is # due to the fact that the V2TokenDataHelper.format_token() method # doesn't build any of the token_reference from other Keystone APIs. # Instead, it builds it from what is persisted in the token reference. # Here we are going to leverage the V3TokenDataHelper.get_token_data() # method written for V3 because it goes through and populates the token # reference dynamically. Once we have a V3 token reference, we can # attempt to convert it to a V2 token response. :raises keystone.exception.Unauthorized: if v3 token is used :raises keystone.exception.Unauthorized:
deleted_lines: # Get v3 token data and exclude building v3 specific catalog :raises: keystone.exception.Unauthorized if v3 token is used :raises: keystone.exception.Unauthorized

commit_message:
Fixes StackWatchService to use objects in place of db

Fixes StackWatchService to use Stack and WatchRule
objects in places of db api.

Implements blueprint versioned-objects

Change-Id: I4f364ef90e4ca58065e974cd9d400d785d465daa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/49/165349/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from heat.objects import stack as stack_object from heat.objects import watch_rule as watch_rule_object wrs = watch_rule_object.WatchRule.get_all_by_stack(cnxt, sid) watch_rule_object.WatchRule.update_by_id( cnxt, wr.id, {'last_evaluated': now}) children = stack_object.Stack.get_all_by_owner_id(cnxt, sid) db_stack = stack_object.Stack.get_by_id(admin_context, sid, tenant_safe=False, eager_load=True) children = stack_object.Stack.get_all_by_owner_id(admin_context, sid) wrs = watch_rule_object.WatchRule.get_all_by_stack(admin_context, sid)
deleted_lines: from heat.db import api as db_api wrs = db_api.watch_rule_get_all_by_stack(cnxt, sid) db_api.watch_rule_update(cnxt, wr.id, {'last_evaluated': now}) children = db_api.stack_get_all_by_owner_id(cnxt, sid) db_stack = db_api.stack_get(admin_context, sid, tenant_safe=False, eager_load=True) children = db_api.stack_get_all_by_owner_id(admin_context, sid) wrs = db_api.watch_rule_get_all_by_stack(admin_context, sid)

commit_message:
Docker plugin add restart policies and capability properties

Add restart_policy, cap_add and cap_drop properties for stability and security.

Closes-bug: #1430197

Change-Id: Iec184fdf5c765217ff7058e8b1390b2f73c59b40
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/77/163277/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "restart_policy": { "Name": "", "MaximumRetryCount": 0 } "cap_add": ["NET_ADMIN"] "cap_drop": ["MKNOD"]

Move test_notifications to functional

Change-Id: I8fa39fa0ba65edeb2b4c7d0b22eb8206f47d3083
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/73/152573/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import logging import eventlet import oslo.messaging from oslo_config import cfg from heat_integrationtests.common import test eventlet.monkey_patch() LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) STACK_NAME = "" ACTUAL_NOTIFICATIONS = [] BASIC_NOTIFICATIONS = [ 'orchestration.stack.create.start', 'orchestration.stack.create.end', 'orchestration.stack.update.start', 'orchestration.stack.update.end', 'orchestration.stack.suspend.start', 'orchestration.stack.suspend.end', 'orchestration.stack.resume.start', 'orchestration.stack.resume.end', 'orchestration.stack.delete.start', 'orchestration.stack.delete.end' ] class NotificationEndpoint(object): def info(self, ctxt, publisher_id, event_type, payload, metadata): # Put into the queue only appropriate messages if 'stack_name' in payload \ and payload['stack_name'] == STACK_NAME: ACTUAL_NOTIFICATIONS.append(event_type) class NotificationTest(test.HeatIntegrationTest): basic_template = ''' heat_template_version: 2013-05-23 resources: random1: type: OS::Heat::RandomString ''' update_basic_template = ''' heat_template_version: 2013-05-23 resources: random1: type: OS::Heat::RandomString random2: type: OS::Heat::RandomString ''' def cleunup(self): global ACTUAL_NOTIFICATIONS ACTUAL_NOTIFICATIONS = [] def setUp(self): super(NotificationTest, self).setUp() self.client = self.orchestration_client transport = oslo.messaging.get_transport(cfg.CONF) targets = [oslo.messaging.Target(topic='notifications', exchange='heat')] self.listener = oslo.messaging.get_notification_listener( transport, targets, [NotificationEndpoint()], executor='eventlet') self.addCleanup(self.cleunup) def test_basic_notification(self): # Test scanario: # 1)CREATE -> UPDATE -> SUSPEND -> RESUME -> DELETE the stack # 2) Make sure that we receive all expected messages self.listener.start() global STACK_NAME STACK_NAME = self._stack_rand_name() stack_identifier = self.stack_create(template=self.basic_template, stack_name=STACK_NAME) self.update_stack(stack_identifier, template=self.update_basic_template) self.stack_suspend(stack_identifier) self.stack_resume(stack_identifier) self._stack_delete(stack_identifier) # Switch context to listener for receiving notifications eventlet.sleep(2) for n in BASIC_NOTIFICATIONS: self.assertIn(n, ACTUAL_NOTIFICATIONS) self.listener.stop()

commit_message:
Add DESIGNATE_SQL_DEBUG toggle

* Setting to False hides SQL Debug logs in test output
* eg:
  export DESIGNATE_SQL_DEBUG=False

Change-Id: Iefbb166da129378ed0780b10dafb46551719a7a9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/70/165070/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if os.getenv('DESIGNATE_TOX_SQL_DEBUG', True): connection_debug = 50 else: connection_debug = 0 connection_debug=connection_debug,
deleted_lines: connection_debug=50,

commit_message:
Fix config drive not created when boot from volume

When booting a instance from volume, destination_type is needed
to set to volume in block device mapping v2. However, parameter
block device mapping v2 is not in heat when booting an instance,
so we need to add it as property for OS::Nova::Server.

Change-Id: Ie56358ed6fdb7cda4a28d546817c31e71ca179b3
Closes-Bug: #1358624

added_lines: def test_build_block_device_mapping_v2(self): self.assertIsNone(servers.Server._build_block_device_mapping_v2([])) self.assertIsNone(servers.Server._build_block_device_mapping_v2(None)) self.assertEqual([{ 'uuid': '1', 'source_type': 'volume', 'destination_type': 'volume', 'boot_index': 0, 'delete_on_termination': False} ], servers.Server._build_block_device_mapping([ {'volume_id': '1'} ])) self.assertEqual([{ 'uuid': '1', 'source_type': 'snapshot', 'destination_type': 'volume', 'boot_index': 0, 'delete_on_termination': False} ], servers.Server._build_block_device_mapping([ {'snapshot_id': '1'} ])) def test_validate_with_both_blk_dev_map_and_blk_dev_map_v2(self): stack_name = 'invalid_stack' t, stack = self._setup_test_stack(stack_name) bdm = [{'device_name': 'vda', 'volume_id': '1234', 'volume_size': '10'}] bdm_v2 = [{'snapshot_id': '1'}] Properties = t['Resources']['WebServer']['Properties'] Properties['block_device_mapping'] = bdm Properties['block_device_mapping_v2'] = bdm_v2 server = servers.Server('server_create_image_err', t['Resources']['WebServer'], stack) exc = self.assertRaises(exception.StackValidationFailed, server.validate) msg = ('Can not specific both block device mapping and block and ' 'block device mapping v2.') self.assertEqual(msg, str(exc))

commit_message:
Added Schemas to DesignateObjects

This enables the <object>.validate() command

Partially-Implements: blueprint validation-cleanup

commit_message:
Allow pod resource management by "name".

This patch supports pod API calling with name
along with the id also.

Eg.
    magnum pod-delete pod1
This will delete a pod with name pod1.

This patch supports named based resource management
for pod resource and below is the list of APIs:
    GET /v1/pods/<name/id>
    DELETE /v1/pods/<name/id>

Change-Id: I16b992c22ed39ae9bb7c35dc36e5aec9609460b4
Partially-Implements: blueprint name-based-resource-management

deleted_lines: def pod_delete(self, context, uuid): LOG.debug("pod_delete %s", uuid) pod = objects.Pod.get_by_uuid(context, uuid) LOG.warn(msg, uuid)

commit_message:
Huawei driver check before associating LUN to a LUN group

This commit fixes the following problems:
* Change in huawei_t.py removes the duplicated wwns
  returned from the array.
* Change in rest_common.py adds log print for response
  data from the array.
* Change in rest_common.py does a check before associating
  a LUN to a LUN group.
* Change in rest_common.py fixes the REST request.
* Change in ssh_common.py checks whether the hostlunid
  have already been assigned.

Closes-Bug: #1411904
Change-Id: I862ed5d71780fb7b8cbc5ed257072ea1113fead7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/44/148144/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return list(set(wwns))
deleted_lines: return wwns

for service resource and below is the list of APIs:
    GET /v1/services/<name/id>
    DELETE /v1/services/<name/id>

Change-Id: Ieddfcd41fe6f7812a032b34e4689193d9b334d34
Partially-Implements: blueprint name-based-resource-management
'}]
commit_message:
Allow service resource management by "name".

This patch supports service API calling with name
along with the id also.

Eg.
    magnum service-delete service1
This will delete a service with name service1.

This patch supports named based resource management
for service resource and below is the list of APIs:
    GET /v1/services/<name/id>
    DELETE /v1/services/<name/id>

Change-Id: Ieddfcd41fe6f7812a032b34e4689193d9b334d34
Partially-Implements: blueprint name-based-resource-management

commit_message:
Disable cleaning by default

Until the new "cleaning" state, and its associated states and the
additional time required during instance deletion, are supported
by Nova, this option must be disabled.

Enabling cleaning prior to Nova's support for it will lead to
instance deletion failures (and in general a bad user experience).

Implements bp/implement-cleaning-states
Change-Id: I806579b6e9f3de12b68c153d31b51e204b87f218

commit_message:
Improve styling for key pair detail table

In the Access and Security step of the new Launch Instance Wizard,
there is a detail table that shows when expanding the key pairs.
Currently the key pair public key is displayed within a textarea with
a white background. This patch removes the textarea and outputs the
public key into pre and code tags so that it follows standard design
patterns/conventions, and also is responsive in width and bkg color

Closes-Bug: 1433696
Change-Id: I6d1cd7892ae8301c879e874ddabf31cc22fb8f24

commit_message:
Expand help message on some quota config options

There are two config options related to keeping quotas in sync which
could be very useful for deployers who are having issues with that.
They're quietly tucked away at the moment and it may not be clear that
they should be used.  This expands the help message to explain why they
default to off and that it may be useful to turn them on.

Change-Id: I27a08bacf01aa2a4b285b50df97337c985291195

commit_message:
Refactoring related to 'FWaaS insertion Model on Routers'

This patch set refactors the Brocade Vyatta Firewall vendor code to support the
neutron-fwaas community Change-Id: I0eba4b0aa127738397e6b9c45556e207216d79c7
that supports
- multiple firewalls per tenant
- associating firewalls to routers

Closes-Bug: #1433196
Change-Id: Ia63b50df6593c729ceacbd488f625f332e973655

commit_message:
Add pxe_irmc to the sending IPMI sensor data driver list

Starting with Kilo release, pxe_irmc supports the sending IPMI sensor
data Ceilometer.

Change-Id: Ica8122a8a21e86ccc407e44185d90b5eab7d8ce7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/13/165313/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pxe_ipminative, agent_ipmitool, agent_pyghmi, agent_ilo, iscsi_ilo, pxe_ilo, and with pxe_irmc driver starting from Kilo release. By default, support for sending IPMI sensor data to Ceilometer is disabled. If you want to enable it, you should make the following two changes in ``ironic.conf``:

commit_message:
Move backend LDAP role testing to the new backend testing module

This patch adds the basic LDAP scenarios to the new backend
testing modules, and moves any LDAP-specific role tests there
as well. This completes the move of backend role management
testing into the new structure.

The LDAP support for domain-specific (i.e. multi-domain)
capability will be moved over in a subsequent patch. This is
not an issue for role testings - since role management is not
affected by identity multi-domain support

Partially Implements: blueprint backends-tests-restructuration
Change-Id: I11b47f5e7386f82778096994f1914e5ed2381e5e

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import ldap from keystone.common import cache from keystone.common import ldap as common_ldap from keystone.common.ldap import core as common_ldap_core from keystone.common import sql from keystone import config from keystone.tests import unit as tests from keystone.tests.unit import default_fixtures from keystone.tests.unit import fakeldap from keystone.tests.unit.ksfixtures import database CONF = config.CONF def create_group_container(identity_api): # Create the groups base entry (ou=Groups,cn=example,cn=com) group_api = identity_api.driver.group conn = group_api.get_connection() dn = 'ou=Groups,cn=example,cn=com' conn.add_s(dn, [('objectclass', ['organizationalUnit']), ('ou', ['Groups'])]) class BaseBackendLdapTests(object): """Mixin class to set up generic LDAP backends.""" def setUp(self): super(BaseBackendLdapTests, self).setUp() self.clear_database() common_ldap.register_handler('fake://', fakeldap.FakeLdap) self.load_backends() self.load_fixtures(default_fixtures) self.addCleanup(common_ldap_core._HANDLERS.clear) def _get_domain_fixture(self): """Domains in LDAP are read-only, so just return the static one.""" return self.resource_api.get_domain(CONF.identity.default_domain_id) def clear_database(self): for shelf in fakeldap.FakeShelves: fakeldap.FakeShelves[shelf].clear() def reload_backends(self, domain_id): # Only one backend unless we are using separate domain backends self.load_backends() def get_config(self, domain_id): # Only one conf structure unless we are using separate domain backends return CONF def config_overrides(self): super(BaseBackendLdapTests, self).config_overrides() self.config_fixture.config( group='identity', driver='keystone.identity.backends.ldap.Identity') def config_files(self): config_files = super(BaseBackendLdapTests, self).config_files() config_files.append(tests.dirs.tests_conf('backend_ldap.conf')) return config_files def get_user_enabled_vals(self, user): user_dn = ( self.identity_api.driver.user._id_to_dn_string(user['id'])) enabled_attr_name = CONF.ldap.user_enabled_attribute ldap_ = self.identity_api.driver.user.get_connection() res = ldap_.search_s(user_dn, ldap.SCOPE_BASE, u'(sn=%s)' % user['name']) if enabled_attr_name in res[0][1]: return res[0][1][enabled_attr_name] else: return None class BaseBackendLdapRole(object): """Mixin class to set up an all-LDAP configuration.""" def setUp(self): # NOTE(dstanek): The database must be setup prior to calling the # parent's setUp. The parent's setUp uses services (like # credentials) that require a database. self.useFixture(database.Database()) super(BaseBackendLdapRole, self).setUp() def load_fixtures(self, fixtures): # Override super impl since need to create group container. create_group_container(self.identity_api) super(BaseBackendLdapRole, self).load_fixtures(fixtures) class BaseBackendLdapIdentitySqlEverythingElse(tests.SQLDriverOverrides): """Mixin base for Identity LDAP, everything else SQL backend tests.""" def config_files(self): config_files = super(BaseBackendLdapIdentitySqlEverythingElse, self).config_files() config_files.append(tests.dirs.tests_conf('backend_ldap_sql.conf')) return config_files def setUp(self): self.useFixture(database.Database()) super(BaseBackendLdapIdentitySqlEverythingElse, self).setUp() self.clear_database() self.load_backends() cache.configure_cache_region(cache.REGION) self.engine = sql.get_engine() self.addCleanup(sql.cleanup) sql.ModelBase.metadata.create_all(bind=self.engine) self.addCleanup(sql.ModelBase.metadata.drop_all, bind=self.engine) self.load_fixtures(default_fixtures) # defaulted by the data load self.user_foo['enabled'] = True def config_overrides(self): super(BaseBackendLdapIdentitySqlEverythingElse, self).config_overrides() self.config_fixture.config( group='identity', driver='keystone.identity.backends.ldap.Identity') self.config_fixture.config( group='resource', driver='keystone.resource.backends.sql.Resource') self.config_fixture.config( group='assignment', driver='keystone.assignment.backends.sql.Assignment') class BaseBackendLdapIdentitySqlEverythingElseWithMapping(object): """Mixin base class to test mapping of default LDAP backend. The default configuration is not to enable mapping when using a single backend LDAP driver. However, a cloud provider might want to enable the mapping, hence hiding the LDAP IDs from any clients of keystone. Setting backward_compatible_ids to False will enable this mapping. """ def config_overrides(self): super(BaseBackendLdapIdentitySqlEverythingElseWithMapping, self).config_overrides() self.config_fixture.config(group='identity_mapping', backward_compatible_ids=False)

commit_message:
Allow devstack plugins to specify prereq packages

We offer main devstack components the ability to install their own
system package preqreqs via files/{debs, rpms}/$service.  This adds
similar functionality for plugins, who can now do the same in their
own tree at ./devstack/files/{debs, rpms}/$plugin.

Change-Id: I63af8dc54c75a6e80ca4b2a96c76233a0795aabb

Implements: blueprint couchdb-plugin-trove
'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2015-03-13 21:00:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/32d066945a0290a999b11705874d3a0ab81a9211', 'message': 'Add support for CouchDB datastore in Trove

The following features have been implemented in this patchset:
- Launch/Reboot/Terminate
- Included unit tests for the different methods

CouchDB does not have a direct way of doing backups and restore
like other datastores like MySQL for example. The most common way
that CouchDB supports backups is to use its replication API. Since
this is quite different from how Trove does backups and replication,
we will continue to work on the following features in the next
release:
- Backup and Restore
- Replication

Change-Id: I4e49a9c8f08a97a4622e6a1cce58aa7d9002cd06
Implements: blueprint couchdb-plugin-trove
'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2015-03-13 21:27:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/d9de45c8328b3bfa2b68ec34134473785a0d9a26', 'message': 'Add support for CouchDB datastore in Trove

The following features have been implemented in this patchset:
- Launch/Reboot/Terminate
- Included unit tests for the different methods

CouchDB does not have a direct way of doing backups and restore
like other datastores like MySQL for example. The most common way
that CouchDB supports backups is to use its replication API. Since
this is quite different from how Trove does backups and replication,
we will continue to work on the following features in the next
release:
- Backup and Restore
- Replication

commit_message:
Add support for CouchDB datastore in Trove

The following features have been implemented in this patchset:
- Launch/Reboot/Terminate
- Included unit tests for the different methods

CouchDB does not have a direct way of doing backups and restore
like other datastores like MySQL for example. The most common way
that CouchDB supports backups is to use its replication API. Since
this is quite different from how Trove does backups and replication,
we will continue to work on the following features in the next
release:
- Backup and Restore
- Replication

Change-Id: I4e49a9c8f08a97a4622e6a1cce58aa7d9002cd06
Implements: blueprint couchdb-plugin-trove

commit_message:
Fix Terminate Instance on network topology page

It failed because not all the info expected by the
`project.instances.IndexView` was provided by network topology view
while rendering part of Instances table in an iframe.

Change-Id: If36f877517d454430320b90362fd0d5207dbf9df
Closes-Bug: #1398468

commit_message:
Adding auto-dismiss alert to angular api services

Currently, the alerts do not disappear.
This patch adds the missing auto-dismiss behavior.

Partially Implemenents: blueprint angularize-identity-tables

Change-Id: I6667212ffcac167c81583c78cac3d451eeb874af

subject: Create global_filter to avoid scan of missing devs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-18 03:18:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/44762266c63df4f3cdf5543afcfdb3c452c217a6', 'message': "e global_filter to avoid scan of missing devs

A while back I added an lvm.conf file with a device filter setting
to try and clean up the LVM hangs in the gate:
  (commit 0b9e76f280208b5b5ad54bb6fbc4133e63037286)

It turns out this wasn't the real problem, the real problem
is that on an LVS/VGS command LVM  will attempt to open and read
all potential block devices in /dev to see if they have LVM data
on them.  I initiallly thought the local filter would keep that
from happening, as it turns out the local filter only limits what's
returned AFTER the actual scan process.  In order to keep the scan
from happening at all, either a global_filter needs to be used or
lvmetad needs to be running and enabled.

There are situations in gate tests where /dev/sdX devices are created and
deleted and the result is that we hit situations where LVM tries
to open up devices to check them even if they've been removed.  The
result is we have a blocking open call from LVM that takes approx
60 seconds to time out and fail.

Ubuntu won't have a version of lvmetad until Vivid, so for now
that just leaves the global_filter as an option.

This patch adds the filter routine to the end of stack.sh.  We don't
want to put the routine in lib/cinder_backend/lvm like we had it because
now we have to set the global filter for all LVM commands on the system.
So we put this as one of the last steps in stack.sh and run it if Cinder
is enabled.  Tis way we can query PV's on the system regardless of what
other services may be running and using LVM and make sure that all of
their devices are added to the filter as well.

Follow up patch will remove the afformentioned local filters.

DocImpact
Should add this to recommended config for Cinder on systems
that don't have lvmetad, and recommend lvmetad for those that do.

Change-Id: I5d5c48e188cbb9b4208096736807f082bce524e8
Closes-Bug: #1373513

commit_message:
Create global_filter to avoid scan of missing devs

A while back I added an lvm.conf file with a device filter setting
to try and clean up the LVM hangs in the gate:
  (commit 0b9e76f280208b5b5ad54bb6fbc4133e63037286)

It turns out this wasn't the real problem, the real problem
is that on an LVS/VGS command LVM  will attempt to open and read
all potential block devices in /dev to see if they have LVM data
on them.  I initially thought the local filter would keep that
from happening, as it turns out the local filter only limits what's
returned AFTER the actual scan process.  In order to keep the scan
from happening at all, either a global_filter needs to be used or
lvmetad needs to be running and enabled.

There are situations in gate tests where /dev/sdX devices are created and
deleted and the result is that we hit situations where LVM tries
to open up devices to check them even if they've been removed.  The
result is we have a blocking open call from LVM that takes approx
60 seconds to time out and fail.

Ubuntu won't have a version of lvmetad until Vivid, so for now
that just leaves the global_filter as an option.

This patch adds the filter routine to the end of stack.sh.  We don't
want to put the routine in lib/cinder_backend/lvm like we had it because
now we have to set the global filter for all LVM commands on the system.
So we put this as one of the last steps in stack.sh and run it if Cinder
is enabled.  This way we can query PV's on the system regardless of what
other services may be running and using LVM and make sure that all of
their devices are added to the filter as well.

Also, make sure we only set this for Ubuntu as Fedora/RHEL variants
utilize lvmetad.

This patch also removes the old change that set the local filter.

DocImpact
Should add this to recommended config for Cinder on systems
that don't have lvmetad, and recommend lvmetad for those that do.

Change-Id: I5d5c48e188cbb9b4208096736807f082bce524e8
Closes-Bug: #1373513
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/81/165281/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Set LVM device filter # ===================== # Gather all devices configured for LVM and # use them to build a global device filter function set_lvm_filter { local filter_suffix='"r|.*|" ]' local filter_string="global_filter = [ " local pv local vg local line for pv_info in $(sudo pvs --noheadings -o name); do pv=$(echo -e "${pv_info}" | tr -d '[[:space:]|/dev/]') new="\"a|$pv|\", " filter_string=$filter_string$new done filter_string=$filter_string$filter_suffix sudo sed -i "/# global_filter = \[*\]/a\ $global_filter$filter_string" /etc/lvm/lvm.conf echo_summary "set lvm.conf device global_filter to: $filter_string" } # If cinder is configured, set global_filter for PV devices if is_service_enabled cinder; then echo_summary "Configuring lvm.conf global device filter" set_lvm_filter fi

commit_message:
Log when no external auth plugin registered

There was no log printed when there isn't an external auth plugin
registered, making debugging this configuration issue impossible
without a debugger.

Change-Id: I86dd62316c74944a936607b4630ca75b1dcf4381
Closes-Bug: 1432191
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/39/164439/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This will happen if there is no 'external' plugin registered # The 'kerberos' and 'saml' methods will be used this way. # In those cases, it is correct to not register an 'external' # plugin; if there is both an 'external' and a 'kerberos' # plugin, it would run the check on identity twice. LOG.debug("No 'external' plugin is registered.") LOG.debug("Authorization failed for 'external' auth method.")

commit_message:
Fixed deprecated type and encoding test and encoding bug

Binary payloads were being decoded into unicode improperly.

Change-Id: I1aa60c8f2a04e1cc37391d5d3eca98253c3d333a

added_lines: def test_secret_create_deprecated_types_and_encoding( if test_model.payload_content_encoding == 'base64': self.assertEqual( base64.b64decode(test_model.payload), get_resp.payload )
deleted_lines: def test_secret_create_defaults_valid_types_and_encoding( if test_model.payload_content_encoding == 'base64': self.assertEqual(test_model.payload, str(base64.b64encode(get_resp.payload)))

commit_message:
Metadata display widget

Part of new Launch Instance redesign.

Implements: blueprint launch-instance-redesign
Implements: blueprint instance-details-redesign
Change-Id: If9f66d63be825a69577644383bdfa0eece944a21
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/45/151745/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $metadata-display-selector-color: $link-color !default; $metadata-display-selector-hover-color: $link-hover-color !default; $metadata-display-selector-active-color: #666 !default; $metadata-display-separator-color: #ccc !default; .metadata-display { .selector { .selector-item { border-top: 1px solid $metadata-display-separator-color; padding: 10px; color: $metadata-display-selector-color; &:first-child { border-top: none; } &:hover { color: $metadata-display-selector-hover-color; } &.active { color: $metadata-display-selector-active-color; } } } .separator { &>hr { margin: 0.5em 0; border-color: $metadata-display-separator-color; } &>.label { position: absolute; top: 0; right: 30px; } } .description { margin-top: 20px; } .auto-width { width: auto; } }

commit_message:
Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for service_get_all

This patches remove the hard-code permission checks for db call
service_get_all.

There are elevated contexts in the code used to call those methods which
aren't removed in this patch. The elevated context will be cleaned up in
last step. This is safe if we forget removing some hard-code permission.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy

Change-Id: I4f642d67f2837655189afb2640a062b8e591943d

commit_message:
Tox: reduce complexity level to 35

The max-complexity is now set at 35. We are unable to lower this due to
the following offenders:
./nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py:431:1: C901 'VMOps._spawn' is too complex (34)
./nova/network/manager.py:1226:1: C901 'NetworkManager._do_create_networks' is too complex (34)
./nova/network/neutronv2/api.py:370:1: C901 'API.allocate_for_instance' is too complex (34)

Change-Id: I6101dcb594b88d346edd72eea2ef2250c4e2891f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/35/165335/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: # 37 is currently the most complex thing we havemax-complexity=38

subject: URL quote Fernet tokens
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-18 03:08:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/12a9d04d17ee39d6c3a27b131840dd62736bc56d', 'message': "URL quote fernet tokens

The padding in base64.urlsafe_b64encode()'s output is not actually URL
safe, so you have to quote the result when it's of variable length.

Change-Id: I72dbd4ddc066706f6af6ea2f2bcd5f0a6cb9b30c
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-18 03:19:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/26a039933e26a9adfdf7789a2b2156c22e158275', 'message': "URL quote fernet tokens

The padding in base64.urlsafe_b64encode()'s output is not actually URL

commit_message:
URL quote Fernet tokens

The padding in base64.urlsafe_b64encode()'s output is not actually URL
safe, so you have to quote the result when it's of variable length.

In addition, Fernet tokens can always be handled as bytes, despite being
passed in from json.loads() as Unicode.

Change-Id: I72dbd4ddc066706f6af6ea2f2bcd5f0a6cb9b30c
Closes-Bug: 1433372
Closes-Bug: 1431669
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/79/165279/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from six.moves import urllib fernet = self.crypto.encrypt(payload) return urllib.parse.quote(fernet) fernet = urllib.parse.unquote(token) try: return self.crypto.decrypt(fernet, ttl=CONF.token.expiration)
deleted_lines: return self.crypto.encrypt(payload) try: return self.crypto.decrypt(token, ttl=CONF.token.expiration)

commit_message:
Use existing token test for Fernet tokens.

The test_v3_auth.py:TestAuth class has token tests in it. The Fernet token
provider should honor the behavior described by these tests.

Related-Bug: 1433311
Change-Id: I6b07e0c616a05159906e276fe046c825463a02a2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/48/164348/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: response = self.token_provider_api.validate_token(str(token_id))
deleted_lines: response = self.token_provider_api.validate_token(token_id)

commit_message:
Implement Fernet tokens for v2.0 tokens

This takes the existing Fernet token work and extends it for v2.0 tokens.

Change-Id: Iea21d5fc1e5faf3ddcb16c1f32ee2e388599e9a2
Implements: bp klw-tokens

deleted_lines: """Helper method to return a token ID from a response. This needs to be overridden by child classes for on their content type. """ raise NotImplementedError()

commit_message:
[Launch Instance fix] Flavor table should be sorted by RAM

By default, it should be sorted by RAM, not name.
Laid out this way to accomodate user setting later on.
CREATE_INSTANCE_FLAVOR_SORT (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/61094/)

Change-Id: If66de9ffde0259d76f3c912cb96ce8a9583b950b
Closes-Bug: #1433317

commit_message:
The wait_for function needs to be added into all the images

This affects both fedora and the centos base images.
Wait_for will be intregrated into kolla-common.

Co-authored by: Charles Crouch <charcrou@cisco.com>

Change-Id: Ide2304b787d4c3bf6fb3949f09e2cf1f450c2173
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/33/163433/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
#!/bin/bash # Based on # https://raw.githubusercontent.com/openstack/tripleo-incubator/6931c1fc7ed98ce36998c5b82750a880b0365445/scripts/wait_for # # Copyright 2013 Red Hat # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. set -e # exit on the first non-zero status set -u # exit on unset variables #set -x # setting this actually breaks the scripts function SCRIPT_NAME=$(basename $0) function show_options() { echo "Usage: $SCRIPT_NAME LOOPS_NUMBER SLEEP_TIME ARGS" echo echo "ARGS are read and concatenated together into a single command." echo "Execute the command in a loop until it succeeds or the number" echo "of attempts exceeds LOOPS_NUMBER value. After each failure" echo "pause for SLEEP_TIME seconds." echo echo "An optional FAIL_MATCH_OUTPUT variable may also be set to control " echo "if the loop exits early if the commands stdout/stderr matches the " echo "supplied regex string." echo echo "Examples:" echo " wait_for 30 10 ping -c 1 192.0.2.2" echo " wait_for 10 1 ls file_we_are_waiting_for" echo " wait_for 10 3 date \| grep 8" echo " FAIL_MATCH_OUTPUT=CREATE_FAILED wait_for 30 10 heat stack-show undercloud" echo " SUCCESSFUL_MATCH_OUTPUT=CREATE_COMPLETE wait_for 30 10 heat stack-show undercloud" exit 1 } LOOPS=${1:-""} SLEEPTIME=${2:-""} FAIL_MATCH_OUTPUT=${FAIL_MATCH_OUTPUT:-""} SUCCESSFUL_MATCH_OUTPUT=${SUCCESSFUL_MATCH_OUTPUT:-""} shift 2 || true COMMAND="$@" if [ -z "$LOOPS" -o -z "$SLEEPTIME" -o -z "$COMMAND" ]; then show_options fi i=0 while [ $i -lt $LOOPS ]; do i=$((i + 1)) STATUS=0 OUTPUT=$(eval $COMMAND 2>&1) || STATUS=$? if [[ -n "$SUCCESSFUL_MATCH_OUTPUT" ]] \ && [[ $OUTPUT =~ $SUCCESSFUL_MATCH_OUTPUT ]]; then exit 0 elif [[ -n "$FAIL_MATCH_OUTPUT" ]] \ && [[ $OUTPUT =~ $FAIL_MATCH_OUTPUT ]]; then echo "Command output matched '$FAIL_MATCH_OUTPUT'. Exiting..." exit 1 elif [[ -z "$SUCCESSFUL_MATCH_OUTPUT" ]] && [[ $STATUS -eq 0 ]]; then # The command successfully completed and we aren't testing against # it's output so we have finished waiting. exit 0 fi sleep $SLEEPTIME done SECONDS=$((LOOPS * SLEEPTIME)) printf 'Timing out after %d seconds:
COMMAND=%s
OUTPUT=%s
' \ "$SECONDS" "$COMMAND" "$OUTPUT" exit 1

Fix an error in the nwfilter definition

The host directory is /etc/libvirt/nwfilter, not /etc/libvirt/nwfilters

Change-Id: If7dc4a8028477d938aaa0dba20b79589217ceaf9

commit_message:
[Launch Instance Fix] Make "Direct Input" the default in Configuration step

In Launch Instance workflow configuration step, we should make "Direct Input"
as the default selection for Customization Script Source.

Closes Bug: 1433241

Change-Id: Ie650025ca64c7d0b91b689f81fc53dd2712ad6d5

commit_message:
bash_completion now shows only subcommands when subcommand is "help"

Options and subcommands are filtered. Now Only subcommands are shown
when subcommands is "help". Both subcommands and options are shown
when subcommand is other than "help"

Change-Id: Iad9def1b2909af33fd23b0c89559b8de30fa6547
Closes-Bug: #1399747

added_lines: _cinder_opts="" # lazy init _cinder_flags="" # lazy init _cinder_opts_exp="" # lazy init local cur prev cbc cflags if [ "x$_cinder_opts" == "x" ] ; then cbc="`cinder bash-completion | sed -e "s/ *-h */ /" -e "s/ *-i */ /"`" _cinder_opts="`echo "$cbc" | sed -e "s/--[a-z0-9_-]*//g" -e "s/ */ /g"`" _cinder_flags="`echo " $cbc" | sed -e "s/ [^-][^-][a-z0-9_-]*//g" -e "s/ */ /g"`" fi if [[ "$prev" != "help" ]] ; then COMPLETION_CACHE=~/.cinderclient/*/*-cache cflags="$_cinder_flags $_cinder_opts "$(cat $COMPLETION_CACHE 2> /dev/null | tr '\n' ' ') COMPREPLY=($(compgen -W "${cflags}" -- ${cur})) else COMPREPLY=($(compgen -W "${_cinder_opts}" -- ${cur})) fi return 0
deleted_lines: local cur prev opts opts="$(cinder bash_completion)" COMPLETION_CACHE=~/.cinderclient/*/*-cache opts+=" "$(cat $COMPLETION_CACHE 2> /dev/null | tr '\n' ' ') COMPREPLY=( $(compgen -W "${opts}" -- ${cur}) )

commit_message:
cleanup connection pool return

This change ensures that connections that fail to return to the pool are
cleanly closed and exception raised are not returned to the caller.

For rabbit, we also try to reconnection in case of connection failure,
before dropping the connection.

Closes-bug: #1433458

Change-Id: Ic714db7b8be9df8b6935a903732c60aaea0bc404

deleted_lines: with self._connection_lock: self._set_current_channel(self.connection.channel())

Since commit dd25406 of puppet-openstacklib we don't need to pin a
specific release of puppetlabs-mysql.

commit_message:
Allow elements to add drivers to dracut

It is reasonable that elements may need to include additional
kernel modules in a dracut ramdisk.  This is done with the
--add-drivers option to dracut, but previously the value passed
was hard-coded.

This change allows an element to put a file containing its desired
drivers in a dracut-drivers.d directory, and the list there will
be added to the list of drivers added.  This functions in
essentially the same way as the binary-deps.d directory that
already exists for including additional executables in a ramdisk.

Change-Id: Ie892b908d36c175a469f7cde7dd803ad4b1942b6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/78/151778/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --add-drivers "$(cat /etc/dib_dracut_drivers)" \
deleted_lines: --add-drivers "virtio virtio_net virtio_blk" \

commit_message:
Guided cluster creation mode for Sahara

Adding a guide for cluster creation in
data processing.  This is meant to weave
the existing panels and forms together in
a way that can be understood by all users.

Partial-Implements: blueprint data-processing-rework-ui

Change-Id: Icfd0c53e90fdb7a520a034ffcc20a3752976f54c

commit_message:
Update Magic Search version

Update the XStatic Magic Search version to 0.2.0,
to pull in latest fixes and features from Eucalyptus.
This allows Horizon tables to leverage API filtering
(and also client-side filtering) with high usability.

Change-Id: I968a874b51870bd6a39ff48daa24e53c4698007e
Implements: blueprint filtered-client-side-table
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/61/160661/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add Mgmt API For Testing RPC Connectivity

adds a new mgmt api that performs a simple rpc connectivity test
by doing an rpc_ping call.

Change-Id: I0f595185b9eb5670f8208e41c98412b34523ea34
Co-Authored-By: Nikhil Manchanda <SlickNik@gmail.com>
Implements: blueprint guest-rpc-ping-pong
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/19/125819/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Added extra previllege to list all domains from all tenants

The user has to use the command "designate --all-tenants domain-list" to list all domains from all tenants.
When the above command is used "X-Auth-All-Projects" value is set to true and it is passed as a header to
designate.This will allow us to list all domains from all tenants.

Change-Id: I4cd4dd5427f5f35cdec95dbdf36c7386b60a2949
Fixes: bug #1418156
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-designateclient refs/changes/97/160397/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import os self.tenant_name = os.environ.get('OS_TENANT_NAME') if self.tenant_name == 'admin': kw['headers'].update({'X-Auth-All-Projects':'true'})

commit_message:
rabbit: Improves logging

For all transport errors, we first got a log of a failure with a
backtrace like 'Fail to publish message on topic' or 'fail to consume
messages' and then another message like 'AMQP is unreachable'.

But in most case, we retry to consume/publish messages when the reason
is a connection lost.

So, now we don't log the failure message anymore in case of connection lost,
but just message related to rabbit deconnection/reconnection.
The error message and the backtrace are only logged in case of we really fail to
publish a message.

Change-Id: Ifa1b04b348b347bad0b2abec3e759a2ce7815b86

commit_message:
Add the string that helps to activate appropriate VIRTUAL_ENV

Add to the revert_info() additional string:
'source <VIRTUAL_ENV>/bin/activate; ...', that will help to debug
environments on CI.

Change-Id: I25458c1defb8a2987bc121f1f84a61f8904ff010
Closes-Bug: #1433318

commit_message:
Allow passing logger object to request

It can become difficult to trace the client that created HTTP requests
as the logging all goes through the keystoneclient.session logger. Allow
passing the logger through the request function and make it able to be
set via the adapter so it can be set once per client instantiation.

Change-Id: Id45c315bee9a56f1c241210d667470751bf689d5
Closes-Bug: #1421868

commit_message:
Add commands from extensions to available commands

Any project can extend available commands in neutronclient
thanks to change : I5b2fe530c90b5ce1243fc10341d6d434a1ecea7a
However, commands submitted by external modules are not correctly
added to available commands in the client.

Change-Id: I53783f18e7811deee9ae7e1f48fc429afcba8936
Closes-bug: #1430825

commit_message:
Source step - fix donut chart label color

On the source step of the new Launch Instance Wizard, the label
for the donut chart does not match the color in the mockups.
The current code uses the "color" attribute to set the label color,
but it actually should be the "fill" attribute, as that is what is
used by SVG to render the label.

Closes-Bug: 1433669

Change-Id: Iadfda86007932b48191e0abfa846646cc66e4213

commit_message:
Sort snapshots in create CG from CG snapshot

This problem was discovered while testing create CG from CG snapshot.
In create_consistencygroup_from_src() in manager.py, it calls the driver
method create_consistencygroup_from_src() and passes in parameters
including source snapshots and target volumes. The problem is that the
snapshots list is not sorted to be in the same order as their corresponding
volumes. So they may be in the wrong order.

In this patch, the source snapshots were sorted before being passed to
the driver.

Change-Id: I988ce2836f2d553391deeee6e68738356877109b
Closes-Bug: #1430628
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/88/163288/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_sort_snapshots(self): vol1 = {'id': '1', 'name': 'volume 1', 'snapshot_id': '1', 'consistencygroup_id': '1'} vol2 = {'id': '2', 'name': 'volume 2', 'snapshot_id': '2', 'consistencygroup_id': '1'} vol3 = {'id': '3', 'name': 'volume 3', 'snapshot_id': '3', 'consistencygroup_id': '1'} snp1 = {'id': '1', 'name': 'snap 1', 'cgsnapshot_id': '1'} snp2 = {'id': '2', 'name': 'snap 2', 'cgsnapshot_id': '1'} snp3 = {'id': '3', 'name': 'snap 3', 'cgsnapshot_id': '1'} volumes = [] snapshots = [] volumes.append(vol1) volumes.append(vol2) volumes.append(vol3) snapshots.append(snp2) snapshots.append(snp3) snapshots.append(snp1) i = 0 for vol in volumes: snap = snapshots[i] i += 1 self.assertNotEqual(vol['snapshot_id'], snap['id']) sorted_snaps = self.volume._sort_snapshots(volumes, snapshots) i = 0 for vol in volumes: snap = sorted_snaps[i] i += 1 self.assertEqual(vol['snapshot_id'], snap['id']) snapshots[2]['id'] = '9999' self.assertRaises(exception.SnapshotNotFound, self.volume._sort_snapshots, volumes, snapshots) self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidInput, self.volume._sort_snapshots, volumes, [])

commit_message:
add ability to publish to multiple topics

allow the ability to publish to multiple topics so we can have
different consumers for different data. this is done by allowing
users to specify a topic for each publisher rather than using
the standard CONF option.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1431922

Change-Id: Ib919cfa302e05653c788ea84a08eafbca4fe843c

commit_message:
Allow periods (".") in hostnames

Whether or not ironic specs and RFCs allow periods in a hostname, we
should allow it, because in practice that's how hostnames work.

Change-Id: I72ee149c6652ee6a8eb77093a1924f4e7dfddbd5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/43/165443/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Also allow "." because what kind of hostname doesn't allow that. m = '^[a-z0-9]([a-z0-9\-\.]{0,61}[a-z0-9])?$'

commit_message:
Correct token flush logging

The log message for the batch size was at info level, but no admin
is interested in this message. Also, the debug message for the
tokens removed so far was a little confusing, so clarified it.

Change-Id: I2dc03437335ef1536b387417fc08f9f6b52e08ae

commit_message:
Fix RabbitClientUsesSSL Param to be a string

We dont have booleans, just strings. Changing this param's default from
false to 'False'.

Closes-Bug: #1402928

Change-Id: I857051db0aab9558940b87e6967a1396dd797da4

subject: Add a "admin" user via crux to keystone container
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-18 19:48:10.000000000', 'files': ['docker/keystone/start.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla/commit/857a2b1dd2ac371a6a90d4d2a52506efd9977c6b', 'message': 'Add a "admin" user via crux to keystone container

The keystone container was changed to only add a keystone user.  The rest
of the infrastructure in Kolla expects the name "admin" from a "can I
use a client to access the APIs perspective."  As a result, we need a user
for keystone and a user for admin which this patch adds.

Change-Id: I3a3e938f946df1fd5982e89397ef61368f1f3674
'}]
commit_message:
Add a "admin" user via crux to keystone container

The keystone container was changed to only add a keystone user.  The rest
of the infrastructure in Kolla expects the name "admin" from a "can I
use a client to access the APIs perspective."  As a result, we need a user
for keystone and a user for admin which this patch adds.

Change-Id: I3a3e938f946df1fd5982e89397ef61368f1f3674
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/79/165579/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: : ${ADMIN_USER:=admin} : ${ADMIN_USER_PASSWORD:=password} : ${ADMIN_TENANT_NAME:=admin} -n ${ADMIN_USER} -p "${ADMIN_USER_PASSWORD}" \ -t ${ADMIN_TENANT_NAME} -r admin crux user-create --update \
deleted_lines: : ${ADMIN_TENANT_NAME:=admin}

commit_message:
Suppress urllib3.connection INFO level logging

The urllib3.connection library is generating INFO level log messages
for every HTTP connection made to other openstack services. This is not
helpful, so let's suppress them.

Change-Id: I00ba5fadf459a2e3b112f440ea0616c64758a8ad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/55/165455/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'urllib3.connectionpool=WARN',

commit_message:
Add Django-1.7 support

And add initial Django-1.8 fixes

- skip unittests until exceptions are fixed
- Django-1.8 changed the way TemplateLoaders are initialized.
- django.middleware.doc.XViewMiddleware is removed.
- SessionAuthenticationMiddleware was added and will be mandatory for
  Django-2.0

Closes-Bug: #1425892
Partially Implements: blueprint django18

Change-Id: Idfd3f494db7b11a66e2262c9520be88b098fbb7b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/17/161117/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'django.contrib.auth.middleware.SessionAuthenticationMiddleware',
deleted_lines: 'django.middleware.doc.XViewMiddleware',# when doing upgrades, it may be wise to stick to PickleSerializer # NOTE(berendt): Check during the K-cycle if this variable can be removed. # https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1349463 SESSION_SERIALIZER = 'django.contrib.sessions.serializers.PickleSerializer'

commit_message:
Add nova-docker element

Adds a nova-docker element for setting up nova compute configured to use
the Docker driver from stackforge.

A running docker registry is required for the docker driver, this will
come in a future commit.

implements: blueprint tripleo-juno-deploy-cloud-hypervisor-type
Change-Id: Ic9b8a564b691b6fe63c0e640e2a1673d6c08853c
Co-Authored-By: Robert Collins <rbtcollins@hp.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/73/97773/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Nova Compute Docker Configuration {{#nova.compute_hostname}} # Override the service hostname - used for the seed node where no metadata # source is supplying hostnames - see seed-stack-config's config.json. host={{nova.compute_hostname}}-docker {{/nova.compute_hostname}}
deleted_lines: # Nova Compute KVM Configuration

commit_message:
Enable sensitive substitutions into whitelisted domain configs

Allow sensitive options to be substituted into whitelisted options
at the point of consumption by the identity driver. The substituted
whitelisted option is never visible via the REST API.

Partially Implements: blueprint domain-config-ext
Change-Id: I0ead7f1aa064d1796ba24a291c46929accd699e0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/28/159928/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Check if there are any sensitive substitutions needed for each_sensitive in sensitive: for each_whitelisted in whitelisted: try: each_whitelisted['value'] = ( each_whitelisted['value'] % {each_sensitive['option']: each_sensitive['value']}) except KeyError: pass

commit_message:
Increase trove gate job timeout

Increase timeout for trove gate job, gate-trove-functional-dsvm from
95 to 105 minutes and the corresponding devstack timeout to 100
minutes.

New code added for Kilo has increased the time required for some of
the tests and we are falling just under the threshold.

Change-Id: Ic63bb635785719a19deae0d43cae78e39731e3a3

deleted_lines: timeout: 95 export DEVSTACK_GATE_TIMEOUT=90

Manila has the ability for shares to report multiple export locations.
This is an important capability for drivers that manage storage
backends that export shares on multiple network interfaces.  This
commit adds this capability to the cDOT driver.  This commit also
updates the cDOT driver to use backslashes in CIFS export paths.

Change-Id: I772caaad2871a072bb5bc4a505678d9fbf0c579c
Closes-Bug: #1429246

commit_message:
cDOT driver should report all share export locations

Manila has the ability for shares to report multiple export locations.
This is an important capability for drivers that manage storage
backends that export shares on multiple network interfaces.  This
commit adds this capability to the cDOT driver.  This commit also
updates the cDOT driver to use backslashes in CIFS export paths.

Change-Id: I772caaad2871a072bb5bc4a505678d9fbf0c579c
Closes-Bug: #1429246
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/14/165414/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: protocol_helper.create_share.return_value = fake.NFS_EXPORTS self.assertEqual(fake.NFS_EXPORTS, result) share_name, fake.LIF_ADDRESSES)
deleted_lines: protocol_helper.create_share.return_value = 'fake_export_location' self.assertEqual('fake_export_location', result) share_name, fake.LIFS[0]['address'])

subject: Rewrite puppet-sahara from scratch
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-07 14:07:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-sahara/commit/9d940a58a8b631ebfccce14a0d82ecf12a2290d1', 'message': 'Rewrite puppet-sahara from scratch

During the Kilo summit, we talked about the state of the current
puppet-sahara module on stackforge, and especially about the brought up parity with
other modules.

For theses reasons, the rewrite was launched/leaded by Robbie Harwood,
but directly codded on Github (and not in a feature branch in this
repository), for this reason, this patch is non-atomic, and import the
latest frozencemetery/puppet-sahara version¹.

This rewrite/import was approved on puppet-openstack mailing list
(following this thread²).

The «reset» of the stackforge repo was discussed (in order to keep the history
of Robbie module) on #openstack-infra, but it seems we have no simple solution.

¹https://github.com/frozencemetery/puppet-sahara/commit/05af265b15eb3c4e1682ab3fc6dc8b6d750d3e36
²https://groups.google.com/a/puppetlabs.com/forum/#!topic/puppet-openstack/0BETdNvrd70

Co-Authored-By: Robbie Harwood <rharwood@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic3dd7547fdfcba275d8a8b90b8ba84bc3ce1d7c0
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-08 11:18:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-sahara/commit/74b92ac4dec2653516becfe1a6f97d3b162d0d3c', 'message': 'Rewrite puppet-sahara from scratch

During the Kilo summit, we talked about the state of the current
puppet-sahara module on stackforge, and especially about the brought up parity with
other modules.

For theses reasons, the rewrite was launched/leaded by Robbie Harwood,
but directly codded on Github (and not in a feature branch in this
repository), for this reason, this patch is non-atomic, and import the
latest frozencemetery/puppet-sahara version¹.

This rewrite/import was approved on puppet-openstack mailing list
(following this thread²).

The «reset» of the stackforge repo was discussed (in order to keep the history
of Robbie module) on #openstack-infra, but it seems we have no simple solution.

¹https://github.com/frozencemetery/puppet-sahara/commit/05af265b15eb3c4e1682ab3fc6dc8b6d750d3e36
²https://groups.google.com/a/puppetlabs.com/forum/#!topic/puppet-openstack/0BETdNvrd70

commit_message:
Rewrite puppet-sahara from scratch

During the Kilo summit, we talked about the state of the current
puppet-sahara module on stackforge, and especially about the brought up parity with
other modules.

For theses reasons, the rewrite was launched/leaded by Robbie Harwood,
but directly coded on Github (and not in a feature branch in this
repository), for this reason, this patch is non-atomic, and import the
latest frozencemetery/puppet-sahara version¹.

This rewrite/import was approved on puppet-openstack mailing list
(following this thread²).

The «reset» of the stackforge repo was discussed (in order to keep the history
of Robbie module) on #openstack-infra, but it seems we have no simple solution.

¹https://github.com/frozencemetery/puppet-sahara/commit/05af265b15eb3c4e1682ab3fc6dc8b6d750d3e36
²https://groups.google.com/a/puppetlabs.com/forum/#!topic/puppet-openstack/0BETdNvrd70

Co-Authored-By: Robbie Harwood <rharwood@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic3dd7547fdfcba275d8a8b90b8ba84bc3ce1d7c0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-sahara refs/changes/09/145509/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # == Class: sahara::keystone::auth# Configures sahara service and endpoint in Keystone.# === Parameters# [*password*] # (required) Password for Sahara user. # # [*service_name*] # (Optional) Name of the service. # Defaults to the value of auth_name. # # [*auth_name*] # (Optional) Username for sahara service. # Defaults to 'sahara'. # # [*email*] # (Optional) Email for Sahara user. # Defaults to 'sahara@localhost'. # # [*tenant*] # (Optional) Tenant for Sahara user. # Defaults to 'services'. # # [*configure_endpoint*] # (Optional) Should Sahara endpoint be configured? # Defaults to 'true'. # # [*service_type*] # (Optional) Type of service. # Defaults to 'data_processing'. # # [*service_description*] # (Optional) Description of service. # Defaults to 'Sahara Data Processing'. # # [*region*] # (Optional) Region for endpoint. # Defaults to 'RegionOne'. # # [*public_protocol*] # (Optional) Protocol for public endpoint. # Defaults to 'http'. # # [*admin_protocol*] # (Optional) Protocol for admin endpoint. # Defaults to 'http'. # # [*internal_protocol*] # (Optional) Protocol for internal endpoint. # Defaults to 'http'. # # [*public_address*] # (Optional) Public address for endpoint. # Defaults to '127.0.0.1'. # # [*admin_address*] # (Optional) Admin address for endpoint. # Defaults to '127.0.0.1'. # # [*internal_address*] # (Optional) Internal address for endpoint. # Defaults to '127.0.0.1'. # # [*port*] # (Optional) Port for endpoint. # Defaults to '8386'. # # [*public_port*] # Port for public endpoint. Defaults to $port. # # [*version*] # (Optional) Version of API to use. # Defaults to 'v1.1'. # class sahara::keystone::auth( $password, $service_name = undef, $auth_name = 'sahara', $email = 'sahara@localhost', $tenant = 'services', $service_type = 'data_processing', $service_description = 'Sahara Data Processing', $configure_endpoint = true, $region = 'RegionOne', $public_protocol = 'http', $admin_protocol = 'http', $internal_protocol = 'http', $public_address = '127.0.0.1', $admin_address = '127.0.0.1', $internal_address = '127.0.0.1', $port = '8386', $public_port = undef, $version = 'v1.1', ) { if $service_name == undef { $real_service_name = $auth_name } else { $real_service_name = $service_name } if ! $public_port { keystone::resource::service_identity { $real_service_name: service_description => $service_description, public_url => "${public_protocol}://${public_address}:${real_public_port}/${version}/%(tenant_id)s", admin_url => "${admin_protocol}://${admin_address}:${port}/${version}/%(tenant_id)s", internal_url => "${internal_protocol}://${internal_address}:${port}/${version}/%(tenant_id)s", }
deleted_lines: # Copyright 2013 Zuercher Hochschule fuer Angewandte Wissenschaften # All Rights Reserved.# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at# http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # Used to setup the sahara keystone user # class sahara::keystone::auth ( $password = 'sahara', $auth_name = 'sahara', $email = 'sahara@localhost', $tenant = 'services', $configure_endpoint = true, $service_type = 'data_processing', $public_address = '127.0.0.1', $admin_address = '127.0.0.1', $internal_address = '127.0.0.1', $port = '8386', $public_port = undef, $region = 'RegionOne', $public_protocol = 'http', $internal_protocol = 'http', ) { Keystone_user_role["${auth_name}@${tenant}"] ~> Service <| name == 'sahara-api' |> if !$public_port { keystone::resource::service_identity { $auth_name: service_description => 'Openstack Data Processing', public_url => "${public_protocol}://${public_address}:${real_public_port}/", internal_url => "${internal_protocol}://${internal_address}:${port}/", admin_url => "${internal_protocol}://${admin_address}:${port}/", }

commit_message:
Updated help for v2 member-update api

help message for v2 glance member-update api
now displays the Valid Values of member status
variable.

The valid values are: pending, accepted, rejected

Change-Id: Ibe6f55c933668451b407ed9a19c520c3fbf1912a
Closes-bug: #1420707

commit_message:
[Tempest] add cleanup for clone method

Cleanup for `git clone`is required and all cloned files should be removed,
if something gone worng during cloning.

Change-Id: I7cb68efb5c1fb836b98459bbbac5e46afa24ca1d

commit_message:
Promote lbaasv2 api job to both the lbaas and neutron check queues

Non-voting for a few days while we make sure it works everywhere and
is going to be stable, then it will be added voting the check and
gate queues, as per the services split co-gate.

Depends-On: I5d7dff0c8f9c289871b2390b95d4b2ad65ee8814
Change-Id: I657c3207b0e547c205c770953d9c8a44ffe1a39f

commit_message:
Add Ironic cleaning network

The cleaning network is where ramdisks will be booted during
the cleaning process. We want to ensure nodes are being properly
cleaned on tear down.

Change-Id: Ic38de10668c97648d073fdf9a3afc59712057849
Implements: bp/implement-cleaning-states

commit_message:
remove duplicate calls to cfg.get()

In nova/version.py, we were making duplicate calls to cfg.get(), like
this:

  NOVA_VENDOR = cfg.get("Nova", "vendor")
  if cfg.has_option("Nova", "vendor"):
    NOVA_VENDOR = cfg.get("Nova", "vendor")

This removes the "unprotected" calls.

Change-Id: I1993cca4cf5cf6eec6370597b37d4f53127d67a0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/25/165425/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: NOVA_VENDOR = cfg.get("Nova", "vendor") NOVA_PRODUCT = cfg.get("Nova", "product") NOVA_PACKAGE = cfg.get("Nova", "package")

commit_message:
iscsi_ilo driver do not validate boot_option

iscsi_ilo driver do not validate the correctness of the value
given to the 'boot_option' in properties['capabilities'] of
the node.

Change-Id: I40bb559757d9353be18e17cde76c880f62c47033
Closes-Bug: 1432097
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/14/164414/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove context from remotable call signature

This is the final step in removing the context parameter from the
signature of a remotable method.

This includes a change of most of the object hashes, without version
bumps. That's because the hashing algorithm is just looking for changes
in things like a call signature, in order to signal that a version bump is
required. Since context is in the signature, removing it triggers the
alert. However, context is not _actually_ part of the on-the-wire API,
as it is stripped out on the caller side, and re-added on the callee side
(hence why we're making this change in the first place). If the test had
been uuber-pedantic to exclude context from consideration, then the hashes
would not be changing here, but alas.

In short, the hash changes are false alarms and do not mean we need
version bumps for all the things.

Related to blueprint kilo-objects

Change-Id: I89464c0ab7e6e0d84e677b9a69a86468727b6438

deleted_lines: def create(self, context): def save(self, context):

commit_message:
Actually stop passing context to remotable methods

This actually passes None for the context parameter to remotable methods,
ensuring that they cannot regress dependence on it. It also fixes up the
base object tests to be in line with this, and removes the test that verifies
that alternate contexts can be passed.

Related to blueprint kilo-objects

Change-Id: I5a7ab4b157e8b6217644934f60ff17222e6200b9

commit_message:
Remove usage of remotable context parameter in service, tag, vif

This removes the use of the context parameter in remotable methods
in these objects. This is a precursor to actually removing the
context from the call, but we need to remove dependence on the
argument first. Remotable methods should be using the bundled object
context.

Related to blueprint kilo-objects

Change-Id: I8d040a03d0daa314e8fc47747ba8c7735fd744d0

commit_message:
Test fixture for the api database

In order to run fuctional tests against the database we should have a
fixture to handle the setup and cleanup.  This adapts the current
Database fixture to work for either database.  It is left out the Nova
TestCase test class and should be set up in specific test classes that
need it.

Change-Id: I98e98cb6dea0008d36397b4e2bf7fcf9ed721721
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/94/164794/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove usage of remotable context parameter in security_group*

This removes the use of the context parameter in remotable methods
in these objects. This is a precursor to actually removing the
context from the call, but we need to remove dependence on the
argument first. Remotable methods should be using the bundled object
context.

Related to blueprint kilo-objects

Change-Id: I4165bce384a8b6021f15f056e2f13b0a9152611c

commit_message:
iLO driver updates node capabilities during inspection

Inspects hardware to get some of the capabilities

During node inspection, the iLO driver will automatically
update the node.properties['capabilities'] field based on
information provided by the node.

Implements: blueprint ilo-properties-capabilities-discovery
Implements: blueprint ironic-node-properties-discovery

Change-Id: I38781a84b7867d461e1f44a2d05c027f55437edd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/72/163572/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import sixfrom ironic.common.i18n import _LWCAPABILITIES_KEYS = {'BootMode', 'secure_boot', 'rom_firmware_version', 'ilo_firmware_version', 'server_model', 'max_raid_level', 'pci_gpu_devices', 'sr_iov_devices', 'nic_capacity'}def _create_supported_capabilities_dict(capabilities): """Creates a capabilities dictionary from supported capabilities in ironic. :param capabilities: a dictionary of capabilities as returned by the hardware. :returns: a dictionary of the capabilities supported by ironic and returned by hardware. """ valid_cap = {} valid_keys = set(CAPABILITIES_KEYS) received_keys = capabilities for key in received_keys: if key in valid_keys: value = capabilities.get(key) valid_cap[key] = value return valid_cap def _add_or_update_capability_str(node_capabilities, new_capabilities): """Add or update a capability to the capabilities string. This method adds/updates a given property to the capabilities string. Currently the capabilities are recorded as a string in properties/capbilities of a Node. It's of the below format: properties/capabilities='boot_mode:bios,boot_option:local' :param node_capabilities: capabilities string as present on node. :param new_capabilities: the capabilities returned by baremetal with inspection. :returns: The capability string after adding/updating the new_capabilities :raises: InvalidParameterValue, if node_capabilities is malformed. """ cap_dict = {} if node_capabilities: try: cap_dict = dict(x.split(':', 1) for x in node_capabilities.split(',')) except ValueError: # Capabilities can be filled by operator. ValueError can # occur in malformed capabilities like: # properties/capabilities='boot_mode:bios,boot_option'. msg = _("Node has invalid capabilities string %s, " "unable to modify the node's capabilities " "string") % node_capabilities raise exception.InvalidParameterValue(msg) if isinstance(new_capabilities, dict): for key, val in new_capabilities.items(): cap_dict[key] = val else: LOG.warn(_LW("The expected format of capabilities from inspection " "is dictionary, returning umodified node's " "capabilities")) return ','.join(['%(key)s:%(value)s' % {'key': key, 'value': value} for key, value in six.iteritems(cap_dict)]) :param macs: a list of mac addresses returned by the hardware with inspection.def _get_capabilities(ilo_object): """inspects hardware and gets additional capabilities. :param ilo_object: an instance of ilo drivers. :returns : a string of capabilities like 'key1:value1,key2:value2,key3:value3' or None. """ try: capabilities = ilo_object.get_server_capabilities() except ilo_error.IloError: LOG.info(_LI("Server was unable to get any additional capabilities")) return capabilities # Inspect the hardware for additional hardware capabilities. # Since additional hardware capabilities may not apply to all the # hardwares, the method inspect_hardware() doesn't raise an error # for these capabilities. capabilities = _get_capabilities(ilo_object) if capabilities: valid_cap = _create_supported_capabilities_dict(capabilities) node_capabilities = task.node.properties.get('capabilities') capabilities = _add_or_update_capability_str(node_capabilities, valid_cap) task.node.properties['capabilities'] = capabilities else: LOG.info(_LI("No extra capabilities returned by server"))
deleted_lines: possible scenarios: :param macs: a dictionary of mac addresses returned by the hardware with inspection.

This inspects the iLO to get the essential scheduling properties
and additional hardware capabilities which could be used
for node scheduling.
It creates ports if the operator has provided the port numbers
in driver_info of the driver as there is no mechanism out-of-band
to know if server port is physically connected with a ethernet
cable. It populates the additional mac addresses discovered while
inspecting in node.extra so that operator can create the ports
manually by retreiving mac addresses from node.extra after
inspection(if he wishes to).

Implements: blueprint ilo-properties-capabilities-discovery
Implements: blueprint ironic-node-properties-discovery

DocImpact

commit_message:
iLO implementation for hardware inspection

This inspects the iLO to get the essential scheduling properties
and create the ironic ports for the requested macs.

It creates ports if the operator has provided the port numbers
in driver_info of the driver as there is no mechanism out-of-band
to know if server port is physically connected with a ethernet
cable.

Implements: blueprint ironic-node-properties-discovery

DocImpact

Change-Id: I0427f2657dab1145b90738760b1853689536a1e1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/96/151596/30 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from ironic.drivers.modules.ilo import inspect as ilo_inspect self.inspect = ilo_inspect.IloInspect()

subject: Remove usage of remotable context parameter in pci_device, quotas
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-13 16:39:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/639b196877e4187cbd8b30ba26715424035fed18', 'message': 'Remove usage of remotable context parameter in pci_device, quotas

This removes the use of the context parameter in remotable methods
in these objects. This is a precursor to actually removing the
context from the call, but we need to remove dependence on the
argument first. Remotable methods should be using the bundled object
context.

Related to blueprint kilo-objects

Change-Id: I408572e1606bb4cf8c9da3268819bdcff959e5ca
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-17 14:34:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/dc2e20ea7e63ca8a25223b7aa15a12981277c810', 'message': 'Remove usage of remotable context parameter in pci_device, quotas

This removes the use of the context parameter in remotable methods
in these objects. This is a precursor to actually removing the
context from the call, but we need to remove dependence on the
argument first. Remotable methods should be using the bundled object
context.
